Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.  

 

Title: ‚ÄúNew layers or an editor for Java Edition‚Äù  

 

Text: ‚Äú-Let them put in minecraft Java one or more new layers, some free, some for payment... -The editor would be for the community to create some layers and of those that players vote for the best and every week or every month put it in the game. *This would be for Java Edition *‚Äù 

- Translated by Admin
i have had the same idea in the past
That was what I was thinking! üòÅü§ô Hope it gets enough votes üó≥ and gets into vanilla Minecraft!

I had an idea simaler to this where a player could put a banner on their back by putting a banner in their off-hand. It should be able to be any type of banner including loomed banners and ominous banners.
With the new update you can be like a winged hussar if they implement this idea in the game, holding a spear and riding a horse while having a banner on your back would go crazy

There actually is a way to do this on Bedrock. Set both "Do Daylight Cycle" and "Always Day" to off and change the time to your desired tick. That way you can freeze the game in any time you like. I don't know if this works on Java, though.

You could also set up a command block to constantly change the time back to night, if you like.

Do
/gamerule doDaylightCycle false
and
/time set night
You can wait for night and disable night and day cicles.
The feature itself is doable, but this would make it easyer.
I would enjoy this idea on my Nintendo Switch. My brother went crazy in the marketplace trying to find pixelmon. Pokemon is my passion and i would like to expand that passion to Minecraft.
Pixel on was a minecraft mod. Tell the mod authors if you want it updated to bedrock

But they probably have already picked the design so if someone said the same thing then they'll just keep it. But anyway, I think that the April fools prank will be about herobrine due to them not putting "Removed Herobrine" on the 1.16 update (They do It Every Update)
Well it was actually Minecraft plus. I think we have had better April fools updates before this.
This will happen with the Scripting API. When it can read (and manipulate) chat messages, there will be an Add-on for that.
It would be interesting to have a pirate island for pirates, a treasure island protected by pirates, and a pirate captain who is the leader of the pirates.
maybe you shoulld be able to create your own ships that float with redstone propellers
I have always wanted more danger in the ocean, a sea Kraken would surely make for a good mini boss. The Illager pirates also sound really cool.

Illager pirates are good and have been wanted for a while. I do think shipwrecks should sometimes spawn as normal ships above land that can be raided and they‚Äôd have the pirates on. I don‚Äôt think they should be able to move though. I think there should also be a water/ocean variant of the pillager outpost. I don‚Äôt know if anyone will get this but the outposts in The Wind Waker are a good example. As for the kraken. Would be an interesting idea but I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs very minecrafty and I don‚Äôt think Minecraft is prepared for water based combat.

Contruction of our own ships is already viable, but they can't move on the water. Ship battles and Illager Ships, shotting fireballs on you with aiming dispensers, would be very epic. Another boss for seas related to this mechanic would be some type of "Flying Dutchman" on his ghost ship and causing nausea and bringing fog.

I think that more variety of sea monsters that spawn randomly, spawning like the classic ones from the land, would bring another "dimention" on the Overworld.

Biomes for the seas are already made and large enough to it be able. But crossing sea biomes today doens't seem dangerous or meaningfull as land.

Note: Polar bears are not "Hostile" in Minecraft. They are "Neutral..." Same deal with spiders.

Also, Polar bears hunt people. In real life.

Not to mention Goats in Minecraft, which attack the player without any provocation (ramming)

So: Sharks SHOULD be added as neutral mobs that have a behavior that "attacks" the player without getting aggressive (like goats ramming) or they get aggressive under certain conditions (like polar bears and spiders... those conditions could be a "feeding frenzy" which triggers at a location where an aquatic mob was hurt recently) 

OR Nurse sharks could be added, which would be neutral... like dogs... so many people think they would be passive... 

OR Whale sharks could be added, which would be passive, but might break boats...
silverfish are real and we need another mob in the oceans. They would attack squid. We would be able to kill them for there fins to make shark fin soup, which would fill 2.5 points of hunger
Make them passive because that's how they are irl. I know mojang likes to be accurate so don't listen to the lies of society.

No?

I recently bought a behavior pack off of the store and realized that I can‚Äôt put them on my own worlds and that in order to access it I had to use a template, in other words I wasted my money, and adding this would allow to take the content you purchased and use it in your own way.

I agree. With the money I earned, it is only right that I should be able to use the behaviour packs I payed for within my own world. Additionly, allowing us to use the behaviour packs will open up so many possibilities in a game about making your own journeys.
This would definitely help reduce the number of individual recipes we would have to make for each interchangeable ingredient.
